dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, is Bitcoin just... dead now? Like, seriously?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, is Bitcoin just... dead now? Like, seriously?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, hold on a sec. "Dead" is a strong word, but you're probably seeing all the noise about Ethereum, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, hold on a sec. Dead is a strong word, but you're probably seeing all the noise about Ethereum, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, the article I just skimmed, it says Bitcoin lost, like, ninety percent? And Ethereum's up three hundred percent? How does that even make sense?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, the article I just skimmed, it says Bitcoin lost, like, ninety percent? And Ethereum's up three hundred percent? How does that even make sense?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bitcoin price has lost almost 50% of its value since hitting its all-time high of nearly $65,000 per bitcoin in April. Over the last 12 months, the ethereum price has far outpaced the bitcoin price, with ethereum adding around 1,000% compared to bitcoin's 300%, even when the last week's price crash is taken into account.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so that's been the recent trend, um, over the last little while. Bitcoin hit, like, sixty-five thousand, then dipped. Meanwhile, Ethereum just kept climbing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so that's been the recent trend, um, over the last little while. Bitcoin hit, like, sixty-five thousand, then dipped. Meanwhile, Ethereum just kept climbing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, ethereum is down by more than half after climbing to over $4,000 per ether token earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, uh, Goldman Sachs, like, a big Wall Street bank, they're calling Ethereum the "Uber of information"? And saying it's a guaranteed store of value over Bitcoin? That sounds wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, uh, Goldman Sachs, like, a big Wall Street bank, they're calling Ethereum the Uber of information? And saying it's a guaranteed store of value over Bitcoin? That sounds wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, a leaked report from Wall Street giant Goldman Sachs GS +1.8% has given ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency with a market capitalization of around $250 billion compared to bitcoin's $660 billion, a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of valuecalling it the Amazon AMZN -1.4% of information.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they, um, they're pointing to Ethereum's intrinsic value. Its programming, the whole ecosystem. It's not just a coin; it's a platform, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they, um, they're pointing to Ethereum's intrinsic value. Its programming, the whole ecosystem. It's not just a coin; it's a platform, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ethereum ecosystem supports smart contracts and provides a way to create new applications on its platform, the Goldman Sachs analysts wrote.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A platform for what, though? I keep hearing about, like, DeFi and NFTs? Is that what they mean?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A platform for what, though? I keep hearing about, like, DeFi and NFTs? Is that what they mean?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, um, most decentralized finance apps, and those NFTs everyone's talking about, they're built on Ethereum. It supports smart contracts, all these new applications.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So, um, most decentralized finance apps, and those NFTs everyone's talking about, they're built on Ethereum. It supports smart contracts, all these new applications.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most decentralized finance (DeFi) applications are being built on the ethereum network, and most non-fungible tokens (NFTs) issued are purchased using ether. The greater number of transactions in ether versus bitcoin reflects this dominance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, Bitcoin just sits there, but Ethereum actually does stuff? Is that why it's winning?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, Bitcoin just sits there, but Ethereum actually does stuff? Is that why it's winning?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. Bitcoin, uh, some analysts are calling it a "failed value token" without a clear roadmap. Ethereum, on the other hand, it's fueling all these use cases.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. Bitcoin, uh, some analysts are calling it a failed value token without a clear roadmap. Ethereum, on the other hand, it's fueling all these use cases.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bitcoin is simply a value token with no clear roadmap.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And that's why it's up, like, a thousand percent over the last year, and Bitcoin's, uh, down ninety? Even with that recent crash?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that's why it's up, like, a thousand percent over the last year, and Bitcoin's, uh, down ninety? Even with that recent crash?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the last 12 months, the ethereum price has far outpaced the bitcoin price, with ethereum adding around 1,000% compared to bitcoin's 300%, even when the last week's price crash is taken into account.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, you got it. Ethereum's really decoupled from Bitcoin lately, showing its own momentum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, you got it. Ethereum's really decoupled from Bitcoin lately, showing its own momentum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, I also saw something about "downgrades" to Ethereum? Could that, like, crash the price?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, I also saw something about downgrades to Ethereum? Could that, like, crash the price?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, those "downgrades" are actually upgrades, eventually. They're designed to, like, improve the network, lower transaction costs. So, ultimately, they could make it even stronger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, those downgrades are actually upgrades, eventually. They're designed to, like, improve the network, lower transaction costs. So, ultimately, they could make it even stronger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, some think long-awaited upgrades to ethereum, begun at the end of last year and designed to help ethereum scale and reduce its sky-high transaction costs, could help the ether price reach never-before-seen heights.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, it's less about the coin price fluctuating, and more about, uh, what the tech actually does?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it's less about the coin price fluctuating, and more about, uh, what the tech actually does?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. Ethereum's ecosystem, its utility, that's what Goldman Sachs and, like, other analysts are really betting on for its long-term dominance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. Ethereum's ecosystem, its utility, that's what Goldman Sachs and, like, other analysts are really betting on for its long-term dominance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given the importance of real uses in determining the store of value, ether has a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of value, analysts at Goldman Sachs wrote, according to leaked sections of the report shared on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Okay, I think I'm starting to get it. Maybe Bitcoin isn't totally dead, but Ethereum's, uh, definitely got some serious moves.
